article_title: Los Angeles Approves Raising Minimum Wage for Large-Hotel Workers
article_text:
LOS ANGELES—The City Council approved one of the nation's highest minimum wages for workers at large hotels here.

In a 12-3 vote on Wednesday, council members backed an ordinance establishing a minimum hourly wage of $15.37 for workers at Los Angeles hotels with at least 125 guest rooms. If passed in a final vote next week, the ordinance would go into effect in July for hotels with more than 300 rooms. Those with at least 125 but...
